alert.note: Alert for Howard; Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 4:16PM EDT until September 09 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CARROLL COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... NORTHWESTERN HOWARD...NORTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES IN CENTRAL MARYLAND AND SOUTHEASTERN FREDERICK COUNTIES IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... At 415 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over New Market, or 7 miles north of Damascus, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Observed wind damage. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Frederick, Damascus, Mount Airy, Walkersville, New Market, Discovery-Spring Garden, Green Valley, Linganore-Bartonsville, Libertytown, Monrovia, Ijamsville, Mount Pleasant, Watersville, Poplar Springs, and Unionville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
